benefits.title: Key Benefits Of Brass Ke Bartan
benefits.description: Are you looking for healthy weight loss or a fit life or building immunity? Brass ke bartan are a perfect channel to lead a healthy life. Food prepared & consumed in brass has the ability to increase hemoglobin count. The food is tummy friendly and also heart friendly! The eco-friendly brass ke bartan also take less time to get heated and thus cooking is no longer a long work! Along with making life easy, eating food out of brass ware also helps in preventing abdominal infections. The shiny pital ke bartan add a lovely touch to one's kitchen.

pricing.title: Pure Pital ke bartan at Reasonable Price
pricing.description: Authenticity is a rarity in today's day and age! Especially when it is about health, one needs to be even more careful about spending the right amount on the right things. Peetal ke bartan have tremendous health benefits and thus spending on them is a wise idea. However, do ensure that you are paying for originality and purity. With SANAAYA this tension is no more there. There is a vast range of pital ke bartan ranging from a simple brass kadhai of approx. Rs 3700/- to a brass saucepan of Rs 1300/-. Brass handi, brass tawa, brass masala box, brass ladles, brass cocktail glass are also available.

additional_benefits.title: पीतल के बर्तनों के प्रमुख लाभ
additional_benefits.description: क्या आप स्वस्थ वजन घटाने या फिट जीवन या प्रतिरक्षा निर्माण की तलाश में हैं? पीतल के बर्तन स्वस्थ जीवन जीने का एक आदर्श माध्यम हैं। पीतल में तैयार और सेवन किए गए भोजन में हीमोग्लोबिन की संख्या बढ़ाने की क्षमता होती है। भोजन पेट के अनुकूल और हृदय के अनुकूल भी है! पर्यावरण के अनुकूल पीतल के बर्तन को गर्म होने में भी कम समय लगता है और इस प्रकार खाना पकाना अब कोई लंबा काम नहीं है! जीवन को आसान बनाने के साथ-साथ पीतल के बर्तनों से भोजन करने से पेट के संक्रमण को रोकने में भी मदद मिलती है। चमकदार पीतल के बर्तन रसोई की सुंदरता को भी बढ़ाते हैं।

pure_brass.title: उचित मूल्य पर शुद्ध पीतल के बर्तन
pure_brass.description: आज के दिन और युग में प्रामाणिकता दुर्लभ है! खासकर जब बात स्वास्थ्य की हो तो सही चीजों पर सही राशि खर्च करने को लेकर और भी अधिक सावधान रहने की जरूरत है। पीतल के बर्तन के जबरदस्त स्वास्थ्य लाभ हैं और इसलिए उन पर खर्च करना एक बुद्धिमानी भरा विचार है। हालांकि, सुनिश्चित करें कि आप मौलिकता और शुद्धता के लिए भुगतान कर रहे हैं, पी-ताल के साथ यह तनाव अब नहीं है। पी-ताल पर सभी प्रकार के बर्तन उपलब्ध हैं, पीतल की कढ़ाई लगभग रुपये 3700/- से लेकर पीतल की कटोरी लगभग रुपये 700/- में। पीतल की हांडी, पीतल का तवा, पीतल का मसाला डिब्बा, पीतल की कलछी, पीतल का कॉकटेल गिलास भी उपलब्ध हैं।

gift_section.title: Gift of health, gift of impact
gift_section.description: When every human being is unique, why should your gift be like someone else's? Explore the wide range of premium curations by SANAAYA and experience the joy of gifting customised handcrafted assortments!

section.subtitle: 'ठ से ठठेरा'
section.title: Revival of India's only UNESCO listed craftform
section.paragraph1: SANAAYA aims at reviving the dying craft form of the indigenous Thathera community of Jandiala Guru, Amritsar, who have the distinction of practising the only craftform from India to be listed on UNESCO's List of Intangible Cultural Heritage.
section.paragraph2: Every handcrafted product has a story of its own and is a carrier of the rich legacy and traditions of these artisans.
section.paragraph3: Just like the Thatheras, SANAAYA is an epitome of transforming traditions into trend while converting practice into perfection thus moulding the vessels of hope!

quote_section.title: There Are Easy Choices, And Then There Are 'Right' Choices
quote_section.paragraph1: It is a tough battle when deciding between these two. They don't get along. They're like the angel and the devil that sit on your shoulders talking to you. Each one wants you to listen to them.
quote_section.paragraph2: The right thing may be the toughest and most painful thing to do, but the more reason why we should keep doing it.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To Revive The Age Old Traditions In A Contemporary Manner, And Ensure People Take The Right Choices And Not Fall For The Easy Ones.

story_section.title: The Story
story_section.paragraph1: P-TAL (Punjab Thathera Art Legacy) is the story of a brand which started as a college project under SRCC, to revive India's only UNESCO listed craftform of Thatheras from Amritsar, Punjab. P-TAL aims to become the No. 1 household brand of everything brass, copper and kansa and we currently deal in kitchenware, cookware and home decor segments.
story_section.paragraph2: P-TAL runs on three fundamentals – developing an organised market to promote the craft legacy, creating designs for urban consumers and leveraging contemporary marketing to sell traditional art. We also cater to varied consumer demands and crafts wine glasses, vases and tissue paper boxes from metals and alloys. Besides building a dedicated team passionate about boosting India's artisan economy, P-TAL educates people about.
story_section.paragraph3: In India, eating in brass and copper vessels has been practised for years. Considered beneficial for health, these vessels are expensive and harder to maintain and have lost the favour of the masses in modern times. P-TAL hopes to change that.

impact_section.subtitle: WE RISE BY LIFTING OTHERS
impact_section.title: Our Impact
impact_section.description: P-TAL, which started as a college project, now impacts 55 families of artisans, increasing their monthly incomes by over 1200% in the last 3 years. Just like the Thatheras, P-TAL is an epitome of transforming tradition into trend while converting practice into perfection thus moulding the vessels of hope!
impact_section.conclusion: Easy choices make you happy in the short term, the right choices keep you happy for life. We at P-TAL want to make it easy for you to always take the right choices!

kirtiGoel.name: KIRTI GOEL
kirtiGoel.title: COO
kirtiGoel.shortDescription: A 28-year-old Graduate in Fashion design from Pearl Academy of Fashion Delhi, is responsible for design
kirtiGoel.fullDescription: A 28-year-old Graduate in Fashion design from Pearl Academy of Fashion Delhi, is responsible for design developments & front-end operations of the company.
kirtiGoel.detailedBio: Ms. Kirti Goel, co-founder andhead designer of P-TAL, has a knack for noticing the lesser noticed parts ofthe environment around her which is what makes her design thinking processunique. She has proven experience in conceptualising a young generation artisancommunity centric brand from sourcing, grassroots capacity building, and designdevelopment to improving operational efficiency and enabling marketing acrossmultiple channels.,She is a proud recipient of theWorld Trade Center Award for Innovation and Impact in SanJose, USA. She is engaged in the incubation program of CIIE.Co (IIMA) The Craft catapult. The process gave her experience in brandbuilding and sustainability.,Under her leadership, P-TAL hasbeen a two time recipient of the SKOCH Order of Merit, the highest CivilianHonour conferred by an independent organization.
kirtiGoel.award: (Winner of SheThePeople Digital Women Awards in the E-commerce category, powered by Google)

adityaAgrawal.name: ADITYA AGRAWAL
adityaAgrawal.title: CEO
adityaAgrawal.shortDescription: A 24-year-old Graduate in Economic Honours from SRCC, is responsible for marketing & brand building of the
adityaAgrawal.fullDescription: A 24-year-old Graduate in Economic Honors from SRCC, is responsible for marketing & brand building of the organisation.
adityaAgrawal.detailedBio: Aditya Agrawal, with a head for business and heart for the world, Co-Founder and CEO at P-TAL, spearheads the brand building and growth of the organisation. He completed his undergraduate education in Economics from Shri Ram College of Commerce, New Delhi. He has worked for various social entrepreneurship projects in the water, crafts and agricultural sector leading to a positive impact on more than tens of thousands of underprivileged individuals.,Being the former Project Director at Project Virasat, Enactus SRCC, Aditya led a team of 50 members in the scalability and sustainability of P-TAL. He has represented the projects under Enactus SRCC at various global platforms like World Water Race in Silicon Valley, USA alongwith leading the team to achieve recognition from UNESCO, World Trade Center and Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade.,He has been the national champion and global ambassador to HSBC-HKU Asia Pacific Business Case Competition 2019, world's largest business case competition alongwith being the winner of Indian Case Challenge and accolades in various other business case competitions. Aditya decided to bunk a Pre-Placement offer received through SRCC from a global management consulting firm at the age of 21, to pursue his passion and love for P-TAL even after college. With utmost zeal, unending perseverance and constant continuous growth efforts of the entire team, Aditya hopes to make P-TAL a household name throughout the world.
adityaAgrawal.award: (National Champion and Global Ambassador to HSBC HKU Asia Pacific Business Case 2019, Top 35 D2C Leaders of India, Winner of Indian Case Challenge, Winner of World Water Race in Silicon Valley, USA)

gauravGarg.name: GAURAV GARG
gauravGarg.title: CPO
gauravGarg.shortDescription: A 29-year-old Graduate in Civil engineering from Punjab University, is responsible for coordination with the artisans
gauravGarg.fullDescription: A 29-year-old Graduate in Civil engineering from Punjab University, is responsible for coordination with the artisans for their development and growth, and ensuring smooth functioning of the production supply chain.
gauravGarg.detailedBio: Gaurav Garg, with his passion for social upliftment leads the community engagement efforts at P-TAL to ensure maximisation of impact to artisans all across India. Hailing from Punjab, Gaurav envisions longer and better life expectancy in people all across India and he believes to contribute his part to this through enlightening and equipping everyone with the health benefits of P-TAL products.,A B-Tech graduate with zeal for learning and exploring new things, Gaurav has always excelled at executing the toughest of tasks with ease. He is a firm believer of the fact, 'commerce with compassion' and strives constantly to make an impact while elevating the business on scale. One of the pillars P-TAL rests on, Gaurav brings in rich and varied skill sets to ensure the growth of the organisation as well as the growth of the artisans alongwith it.
gauravGarg.award: (Winner of SKOCH Gold Award, highest civilian honour by an independent organisation)

locations.question: Shipping locations
locations.answer: We ship globally through trusted and reliable partners like DHL, DTDC and Delhivery.

costs.question: Shipping costs
costs.answer: We do not charge anything additional for shipping except for a minimal charge of Rs 50 on COD (Cash on Delivery) orders. Even for our international orders, the shipping provided is free and inclusive in the cost itself.

policy.question: Return and exchange policy
policy.paragraph1: Processing orders of handcrafted products involve days of efforts put in by our artisans and our order processing team. We do not accept returns for orders where the product does not match your satisfaction but is perfect in terms of quality, sizes and other details mentioned on our website. Also once the package is dispatched from our warehouse, its highly dependent on the courier partner, if any delays in delivery please stay patient.
policy.paragraph2: If there are any defects or transit damages in the products, we will accept an exchange of an unused product only if the intimation is done from your end within 2 days after the delivery is executed. Once we receive the returned item, we will process your new order.
policy.paragraph3: Please allow 1-2 weeks post the date of return request for your exchange to be processed. If there are any possibilities of refund in case of damages in shipping, we will refund the amount in 5-7 days after receiving back the damaged product.
policy.paragraph4: P-TAL will not issue returns & exchanges for products purchased through other entities, such as distributors or retail partners.
policy.paragraph5: Returned items must be delivered to us unused, in original packaging and in the condition they were received or may not be eligible for refund or be subject to a restocking fee. We cannot be held responsible for items damaged or lost in return shipment, therefore we recommend an insured and trackable mail service.
policy.paragraph6: In the unlikely event that an item is returned to us in an unsuitable condition other than the reason provided by you for exchange, we may have to send it back to you without processing any refunds or compensation. All goods will be inspected on return.
policy.address_line2: 249, HSIIDC Rd, Barwala Industrial Estate, Alipur, Barwala, Haryana 134118

chef1.name: Chef Vikas Chawla
chef1.text: have been delighting in the exquisite craftsmanship of P-Tal products for the past year. The Chapati Tawa, Dosa Tawa, Frying Pan, and Lagan have all surpassed our expectations with their impeccable quality and thoughtful design, a testament to the meticulous research and care poured into their creation.

chef2.name: Chef Natasha Gandhi
chef2.text: P-TAL has truly been a lucky charm! My food looks more pretty and even tastes more delicious in these brass pots. So grateful that I found them!

chef3.name: Manisha Ahuja
chef3.text: I have bought multiple brass and copper items from P-TAL and my experience has been simply amazing. The products are not only good for health, but also add a beautiful touch to my kitchen and always attract appreciation from all guests!

chef4.name: Dr Shalu Goel
chef4.text: I was looking in the market for brass dinner sets but was not able to find something that looked genuine. When I stumbled upon P-TAL, I thought of giving it a try and I am so happy with their brass dinnerware. Absolutely love the quality and the cause of the brand!

chef5.name: Harbhajan Kaur
chef5.text: I don't remember when was the last time I saw brass utensils, so when my daughter told me about P-TAL, I had an instant sense of nostalgia looking at their products. I feel so thankful to them for reviving and bringing back our traditional utensils in our kitchens, rab raakha!

kalaiKitGalery.descriptionText10: Thoroughly wash the utensil inside out and wipe it dry.
kalaiKitGalery.descriptionText11: Put it on the stove and give it enough time to heat to the brim. You can check if it's heated by touching the tin on the brim and seeing if it's melting.

kalaiKitGalery.descriptionText13: Touch the surface of the tin stick on the utensil and rub it using heat-resistant cloth.

kalaiKitfaq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
kalaiKitfaq.subtitle: Here to help you
kalaiKitfaq.q1: Can we cook sour items in brass and copper cookware utensils?
kalaiKitfaq.a1: You can absolutely cook anything and everything in brass and copper as long as they are tin coated. The tin coating not only makes it safe for cooking but also adds a lot of flavour to the food.
kalaiKitfaq.q2: Does tarnishing reduce the benefits of the metal?
kalaiKitfaq.a2: Tarnishing of metal is a sign of purity and in no way affects the quality or benefits it imparts
kalaiKitfaq.q3: Can we use it on induction cooktop?
kalaiKitfaq.a3: No, these metals cannot be used on induction cooktops since these are non-magnetic.
kalaiKitfaq.q4: Can we use copper for drinking warm water?
kalaiKitfaq.a4: It is ideally recommended to use copper for normal room temperature water.
kalaiKitfaq.q5: How long does the tin coating (kalai) last on cookware utensils?
kalaiKitfaq.a5: The tin coating usually lasts for around 10–12 months on an average, depending on proper usage of the utensils and maintenance of tin.

storyArtisians.heading: Th Se Thathera: Revival Of India's Only UNESCO Listed Craftform
storyArtisians.p1: The words ‘tambaa ke bartan’ sounds very nostalgic as it takes us back in time to the era our grannies stored water in them. Do you remember the time when our mothers used to insist, 'peetal ke bartan' (eat out of brass utensils) are good for health? But have you ever wondered who made these beautifully handcrafted cookware? What has become of that legacy as times go by? Generations remember this handcrafted utensils form out of brass (Pital), copper (Tamba) or bronze (Kansa) which defines cultural and historical identity undergoing their skill fade.
storyArtisians.p2: Here is a story about the artisans of 'P-Tal' hailing from the Jandiala Guru region of Punjab. They are the heroes of these beautifully crafted products that take back in time and are proof of the present.
storyArtisians.p3: A long time ago, Maharaja Ranjit Singh saw the need for a succession of arts and crafts in his new empire, and he thought Amritsar would be the perfect place for artists. He invited skilled workers from Kashmir and other parts of India to settle in Amritsar. The Thatheras, who worked with brass and copper, were among them. This colony of Thatheras was established in Jandiala Guru, a small town near Amritsar, and became a significant center for the craft. Over time, the craft faced challenges, with only a handful of artisans continuing the tradition.
storyArtisians.p4: A proud community of individuals, spend their days hammering copper and brass sheets into vessels. They are unaware of the potential their craft holds. The community which was once characterised by happy faces, cheerful identities and beautiful craft have now been reduced to a group of old men suffering from hearing, heart and lung problems trying to feed their families. Yet, the community is spread across the country and is still carrying on the beautiful craft of handmade utensils.
storyArtisians.p5: Out of the original 500 families at the time of Maharaja Ranjit Singh, a mere 50 craftsmen remain carrying on the legacy in Jandiala Guru, Punjab, the heart of the Thathera community. The younger Thatheras have been lured to jobs in factories or other livelihoods, but the elders remain intact and working as per reputation.
storyArtisians.p6: One of our Thatheras is Manohar Lal ji. If it was not for him, we would have never been able to start this journey of P-Tal...
storyArtisians.p7: In 2018, he was the only one from the entire village who believed in P-Tal's initiative and had faith in the revival of this craft, not even his son was ready to believe that this old-age legacy could be revived again. He has heard the sound of the hammer since he can remember. Being a Thathera is in his culture, his tradition. He truly is the torch-bearer of Karigar ki Virasat (Legacy of Artisans). The pride for his craft legacy and the skill he possesses makes him one of our master artisans.
storyArtisians.p8: Just like Manohar Lal Ji's trust and resilience, Amrit Lal Ji wanted to preserve his identity as a Thathera. Taking immense pride in the work he does, Amrit Lal Ji has truly made every single Thathera in Jandiala Guru believe that their story and their heritage will reach every household in India!
storyArtisians.p9: Hari Krishan Suri Ji is our 'copper mastermind', with a knack for experimenting and exploring, he is ever-ready to design new products in copper. His creation of a copper water dispenser is one of our hot-selling products. His products are not just pieces of craft, they are his identity.
storyArtisians.p10: When you begin to revive a craft there is an initial product development and then the demand follows, and when there is a kind of demand that you think you can never meet, you suddenly realise there is still so much untapped potential.
storyArtisians.p11: Harwinder Singh Ji's story is exactly like that. While working with P-tal he realised that he is again one of those who is made to explore the untapped potential and hence is now spearheading the work of craft revival with several other artisans working with him in his workshop.
storyArtisians.p12: Our artisans are the foundation of P-Tal. Their belief and trust in our vision have helped us to grow as a brand. Without them, we would lose the beauty and essence we are so focused on reviving. They made us just like we encouraged them to revive their heritage.

blogComponent14.title: Bhande Kalai Karalo (Tin Coating)
blogComponent14.p1: “Bhande kalai kara lo” — this nostalgic street call would stir life into neighborhoods as households rushed out with their beloved brass and copper utensils for a fresh coat of tin. Watching the process was nothing short of magical — sparks flying, silver glimmers returning to the vessels, and the ‘kalaiwala’ performing his age-old ritual.
blogComponent14.p2: Ayurveda has always advocated for the use of traditional metals in daily life. Brass, copper, bronze, and stone cookware are rich in medicinal properties. Though modern materials like steel and teflon gained popularity, concerns over health are pushing people back toward traditional methods. Copper retains heat efficiently but reacts with acidic foods — hence the need for a tin lining, known as *kalai*.
blogComponent14.p3: Kalai is the process of coating brass or copper utensils with tin to prevent harmful chemical reactions with food. Traditionally, re-tinning is done every 6–8 months. It ensures the cookware remains safe and enhances the cooking quality.
blogComponent14.p4: The utensil is first washed with caustic soda and acid to remove impurities. It is then heated in a temporary furnace while *nausadar* (ammonium chloride) is sprinkled — producing a white smoke and silvery finish. Finally, the vessel is dipped in water, revealing its gleaming new lining.
blogComponent14.p6: Acts as a safe barrier between metal and food
blogComponent14.p7: Improves heat conductivity and reduces fuel usage
blogComponent14.p8: Enhances taste and maintains food nutrition
blogComponent14.p9: Offers potential spiritual benefits as per Vedic beliefs
blogComponent14.p10: With modernization, we may have advanced, but we've also lost touch with these health-giving traditions. It’s time we revive the art of Kalai, bringing back the glow, taste, and health benefits of traditional cooking — and perhaps, the nostalgic chant: “Bhande kalai kara lo… Bhande!”

blogComponent13.title: Bouncing Back to our Roots
blogComponent13.p1: From television channels that have taken us into a flashback by telecasting Ramayana and Mahabharata, to Shaktiman and Chanakya, we are enjoying our sweet-sour childhood memories. My grandparents are for sure reliving their younger days, sharing stories from the past related to fashion, lifestyle, home decor, and more.
blogComponent13.p2: While immersed in mythology, did you notice the frequent use of brass and copper in that era’s kitchenware?
blogComponent13.h3: Where Have These Traditional Materials Gone?
blogComponent13.p3: Everyone has heard about these metals at some point. In the past, our grandparents used brass and copper extensively in their kitchens. Ever wondered why? It's because these metals offer numerous health benefits. Earlier generations lived a much healthier and hassle-free life.
blogComponent13.p4: One major reason was the daily use of brass and copper. Every household had rustic yet beautiful brass and copper utensils. These added not just tradition, but also nutrition and taste to food.
blogComponent13.p5: Food made in grandma's kitchen wasn’t just delicious — it was nutritious and magical. The magic came not only from the hands of the cook, but also from the traditional utensils that infused flavor and health into every meal.
blogComponent13.p6: Today, there’s a shift. Youth is returning to roots, realizing what they’re missing. My grandparents are happy to see brass and copper making a comeback in our kitchens.
blogComponent13.p7: Chef Amninder Sandhu has reintroduced tools like silbatta, sigri, and mortar-pestle into fine dining. She emphasizes how crushing ingredients by hand releases more flavor than machines ever could.
blogComponent13.p8: Bengaluru brand Zishta is bringing back long-lost kitchen essentials like pure iron tawas, cast iron kadais, soapstone vessels, and brass coffee filters — all handcrafted by rural artisans.
blogComponent13.p9: Pune-based Coppre is reviving copper craftsmanship in kitchenware.
blogComponent13.p10: Purvi Parikh, owner of Mumbai-based Tranceform, notes how people today are choosing sustainable, durable, and traditional cookware over modern materials. Her brand blends old industrial charm with contemporary design.
blogComponent13.p11: Clearly, the world is trying to go green, and traditional cookware is playing a vital role in that transition.

blogComponent12.title: Shaadi Mubarak with SANAAYA
blogComponent12.subtitle: Time to say Bye to Wedding stress; Say Hello to your Wedding Glow!
blogComponent12.p1: Weddings are a time of celebration, happiness, laughter! There is so much to do always. The entire atmosphere is dominated by an exciting burst of energy. Though all this sounds great & feels marvellous; it is not wrong to say that this does add pressure on the ones whose special day it is- The Bride & The Groom!
blogComponent12.p2: While they are about to enter a significant new chapter of their lives, last minute preparations, unimaginable situations, unknown crises surround them. It becomes severely important to stay calm & healthy and look fabulous on your special day. The question is, given the hectic situation, how does one succeed in doing so?

blogComponent12.img2: Intake of Water kept in these vessels help in tightening of skin with better blood circulation. Its Scientifically proven to be healthy for skin.
blogComponent12.p4: It is crucial to know that being at peace with bright glowing face is not achieved within a day or two just by chemical procedures of a salon or so. Daily routines of the bride & groom need a bit of addition during their wedding times. Replacing regular cutlery with Kansa plates/ thalis; drinking water from copper dispenser, eating food in kadhais made of these metals can simply add to the natural glow of these souls.
blogComponent12.p5: The metals inherently have qualities that help in absorption of any impurities. In fact, intake of food kept in these vessels help in tightening of skin with better blood circulation. Apart from this, the regular usage of these metals help in removal of puffiness & fine lines & leads to better skin texture by making sure there are no breakouts on the skin. According to experts, water stored in copper dispenser has the power of diluting any toxins contained within the body. It definitely makes sense that our forefathers were complete fans of these metals.
blogComponent12.p6: Festivity & weddings are supposed to make one feel extraordinary. It is time to gift such an experience to yourself during this remarkable moment of life. Make sure that your notable time is marked not by stress but by glowing & confident self of yours. Because some moments are too precious to be lost, enjoy & gleam through them all with copper & brass metal cutlery.
blogComponent12.p7: Indian weddings define a bond of a lifetime. It is the time when the beautiful charming girl steps out from her father's protective shell & enters her soulmate's wonderful world. A world marked by new dreams & sheer bliss. Each ritual, each event, each step during wedding carries some beautiful meaning.
blogComponent12.img3: In several communities, like Assamese weddings, Kansa utensils are given to the bride as a remembrance of her natal home.
blogComponent12.p8: While they not only look lovely; they inherently have the quality of love. Been handed down to us from generation earlier, the metals appear to be a blessing from our forefathers. Contrary to the technical production, the handcrafted cutlers, cookware, homeware; all speak of warmth & endearment with which they are made by our Thatheras. It is thus not bewildering that food becomes tastier or water seems more fresh when consumed from a brass thaali or copper glass.
blogComponent12.p9: Welcoming all guests at a feast involving all brass thaali sets is the hallmark of royal legacy & makes for a memorable experience. While copper plant dispensers look beautiful as a wedding decoration, the Paraat seems perfect for a new bride to smear her feet in kumkum & carry this auspicious colour into her new household. Thus, the beauty of these metals is abound & can be witnessed at each stage of a wedding function. This is beyond words & defines unbound love always.

blogComponent11.title: Importance of Craft Revival: Copper Water Dispenser
blogComponent11.p1: Indian handicrafts: Diverse, complex & colourful - well this one is healthy too!
blogComponent11.p2: To write about Indian handicrafts is almost like writing about the country itself. So diverse, complex and colourful, and yet with abundance of simplicity and charm. Since time immemorial, Indian crafts served as an integral part of culture and custom of rural and tribal communities.
blogComponent11.p3: The historically imbibed plural aesthetics of Indian handicrafts are priceless economic and cultural assets of the country. However, with the onslaught of fast-paced mass-scale production methods, survival of the traditional arts and handicrafts are at stake. Due to this, artisans are moving to alternative income generation methods, for instance, daily wage labour and farming; and art is losing its grip.
blogComponent11.p4: The handicraft sector carries the stigma of inferiority and backwardness, and is viewed as decorative, peripheral and elitist, with the advent of industrialisation. The main challenges that artisans face in creating sustainable livelihoods today, range from issues of low productivity and inadequate demand chain to problems of exploitation at the hands of middlemen.
blogComponent11.p5: Traditional crafts have largely been marginalised by mass-produced machine-made consumer goods, which tend to be cheaper due to the economies of scale associated with mechanisation. Catering to the mainstream market often necessitates a decline in quality and workmanship, leading to the eventual loss of skills over a few generations. There is a growing need to revive Indian Handicrafts more than ever.
blogComponent11.p6: 01. Identify the product utility, through product innovation.
blogComponent11.p7: 02. Start spreading awareness about the craft & its benefits.
blogComponent11.p8: 03. Start creating your niche, could be through social media or through your social circle.
blogComponent11.p9: 140 years ago, 'Thak Thak' the sound of the Thatheras' hammers striking the lustrous brass was all that echoed the walls of Jandiala Guru, a craftsmen's village near Amritsar. Alas, these soundwaves lessened as the number of families practising the Thathera art form fell from 500 in 1880's to a mere 30 today.
blogComponent11.p10: The fat brass patilis and parats that once adorned the palace of Maharaja Ranjit Singh retained their charm even in the 21st century but lost the market for them. The craft ceased to exist with the younger generations of Jandiala moved to the towns and the thatheras practising this pristine craft shattered gradually and that was when the 'Thak Thak' became rarer than ever.
blogComponent11.p11: Who will buy our paraats and patilis in the modern day market?
blogComponent11.p12: A forlorn thathera once asked, Who will buy our parats and patilis in the modern day market? P-TAL has answered his question! Our team set out to revive the Thathera craft, the only artform from India to be listed under UNESCO's List of Intangible Cultural Heritage. We institutionalised the thatheras under an SHG and with the help of our team of designers, our thatheras are producing contemporary designs to suit the modern markets around the world, and gave existing products the utility. We through social media set on to a journey to spread awareness about the craft & its health benefits.
blogComponent11.p13: The youth of Jandiala have returned back to their legacy from their hideout in towns. Today, the walls of Jandiala echo the 'Thak Thak' all the more stronger. We have got more lives to change and more stones to turn. P-TAL, the one which relishes the true spirit of craftsmanship.

blogComponent10.title: Ayurvedic Cookware
blogComponent10.p1: The leading benefits of drinking water in copper utensils include relief from arthritic pain and hypertension. It also aids in improving cardiovascular health.
blogComponent10.h2: If there are means to acquire nutrients naturally, why are we not taking them up?
blogComponent10.p2: Every individual needs a daily dose of nutrients, irons and minerals in their diet. Our present lifestyle does provide us with our needs but, majority of them are consumed artificially or medically. There are small ways in which one can provide their body with what it needs in a natural manner.
blogComponent10.p3: If observed carefully, you will find a lot of plastic in and around your kitchen. Small plastic containers to store masalas, dry food, cooked food, plastic bottles, etc. In our subconscious mind, we do know that it is not advisable to use plastic when it comes to food.
blogComponent10.p4: Want to know a better and safer option to plastic? Use Brass!
blogComponent10.p5: Using Brass containers is any day better than using plastic ones. Also, the shelf life of the food kept in Brass jars is much more when compared to plastic. The freshness and aroma of the masalas kept in brass jars cannot be sustained in plastic containers.
blogComponent10.p6: To start from the very basic, the use of an 'Iron Degchi'. Any food you cook in an iron vessel, the food absorbs the properties of the metal. We all know our body needs iron. Iron getting into our body in the mildest way, through the food we eat is the best!
blogComponent10.h7: Tip to maintain your iron cookware:
blogComponent10.p7: When you buy an iron vessel, make sure you first dip it in tamarind (imli) water / apply tamarind paste for an entire day and scrub it with sand the following day. Heat water in it, let the water dry or else it will rust.
blogComponent10.p8: Brass, a metal that has a shine like Gold, stores ancient health secrets. The composition of brass makes it the perfect metal to cook your food in, as you add flavors to your dishes, brass adds nutrition to it. Brass helps in providing healthier hair and produces required amounts of melanin.
blogComponent10.h9: Importance of tin coating over brass utensils:
blogComponent10.p9: Brass being the alloy of copper is also dangerous if direct contact with food. So brass utensils are coated with tin so as to prevent direct contact with food.
blogComponent10.p10: Drinking copper-enriched water is top notch! What is the property of water? The property of water is that it absorbs the properties of the material of the container in which it is stored. If water is stored in a plastic bottle, it absorbs some amount of plastic molecules.
blogComponent10.p11: According to Ayurveda, drinking copper-enriched water first thing in the morning on an empty stomach helps balance all three doshas (Kapha, Vata and Pitta) which is good for one's immunity.
blogComponent10.h12: How much copper-enriched water should one consume?
blogComponent10.p12: If one is drinking only copper-enriched water throughout the day and daily, it is advisable for that person to take a break from copper-enriched water after every 3 months. (Excess of everything is bad)
blogComponent10.p13: Kansa utensils are very good for eating, though they cannot be cooked with. Kansa cures the internal imbalances of the body and strengthens bones. It promotes healthy red blood cell formation and regulates various ailments like Thyroid as it ensures regulation of the thyroid gland.
blogComponent10.p14: Just to add on, you also get to spot silverware utensils in the market. If someone is suffering from Autism, feeding such a person from silverware is said to be beneficial.
blogComponent10.p15: One way to enrich your water is by putting a silver ring/ coin/ earring in the warm water and let it stay overnight. What will happen is, the warm water will absorb the properties. And Voila! Next morning one will have silver enriched water to drink.
blogComponent10.p16: These are some natural demands of the human body. It is best to fulfill these demands naturally. But in today's times, we do not follow the old traditional ways. We have exposed our body to the artificial world of medicines/ proteins.
blogComponent10.p17: It is never late than now, to change our unhealthy practices and start taking up a healthier lifestyle. Small steps taken at home will definitely bring changes in our well-being. The best investment one can do is to invest in one's health and in the health of their family.
blogComponent10.p18: 'Kal kare so aaj kar, aaj kare so ab.'

blogComponent9.title: Frolic of Festivities: Celebrating Dhanteras!
blogComponent9.p1: Dhanteras announces the coming in of the Festival of Lights filling the air with gleaming happiness. Considered to be the first day of Diwali festivities, Dhanteras is also called 'Dhantrayodashi' popularly. In common parlance 'dhan' literally means wealth. The day marks worship of Goddess Lakshmi who is referred for prosperity & auspicious life. Since a very long time shopping is regarded as a good omen on this day.
blogComponent9.p2: India is undoubtedly a land of festivals. With each occasion carrying a unique story with it, Dhanteras also brings forth some interesting folk tales that signify history, morals, life & opulence. It shall be most befitting to explore these tales here.
blogComponent9.h3: The Legend of King Hima's Son
blogComponent9.p3: One of the most popular legend talks about a 16 year old son of King Hima. According to horoscopes and predictions he was supposed to die due to a snake-bite on the 4th day of his marriage itself. He thus delayed his marriage but finally tied the knot. On hearing about this sad prediction, his young wife ensured that the prince does not sleep. There was music being played the entire night. The entrance of the palace was all covered with heaps of gold and silver with innumerable lamps.
blogComponent9.p4: At the predicted time, Yama, the god of death came to the palace. However, due to the intelligent plan of the bride, he got completely blinded by the lights and glitter at the entrance itself & thus could not enter the palace. The entire night passed away and the time of death had gone. The prince survived and lived happily with his bride. The shining metals since then are considered auspicious and markers of a long satisfying life.
blogComponent9.p5: In another story, Goddess Lakshmi once insisted Lord Vishnu and came down to earth for a visit. Vishnu agreed on her company only on the condition that she should not get tempted by earthly richness nor look into south direction at all. Though the goddess agreed, she could not resist and started going southwards where she saw yellow mustard flowers and was enamoured by their beauty. She finally gave into the temptations and decorated herself with the flowers.
blogComponent9.p6: Lord Vishnu, on seeing this, got annoyed and told her to live on earth and serve a poor farmer for twelve years as part of penance. Over the years, the poor farmer gained a lot of prosperity and became wealthy. On completion of the twelfth year, when Lord Vishnu came to get the goddess back, the farmer refused to send her. It is then that Goddess Laksmi revealed her true self to the farmer and promised that she shall visit the farmer every year before the night of Diwali. Since then the farmer cleaned his house thoroughly on the day of Krishna Trayodashi before Diwali. He also began lighting earthen lamps to welcome the goddess. Devotees then started worshipping Lakshmi along with Kubera on Dhanteras.
blogComponent9.p7: According to another legend, the gods and demons once churned the ocean for Amrit. It is then Dhanavantri; the physician of the gods and an incarnation of Vishnu emerged with a beautiful jar of elixir on Dhanteras. The popular belief states that devotees who worship Lord Dhanvantari can be released from all disease.
blogComponent9.p8: All folktales send us a special meaning of the occasion. What remains common is the auspiciousness that the festival carries with itself and need to embrace well-being and life. Staying nicely, shopping for new things, keeping home clean and decorated are some of the things that bring a lot of positivity and merriment. This is thus an opportunity to feel special & make everything around extraordinary for your loved ones.
blogComponent9.p9: सोने कार थ, चांदनी की पालकी, बैठकर जिसमें मां लक्ष्मी हैं आई,
blogComponent9.p10: देने आपको और आपके पूरे परिवार को, धनतेरस की बधाई…
blogComponent9.p11: With these words, this year let cheer knock your door and welcome the high spirits with smile on face & satisfaction in hearts.

blogComponent8.title: A Home away from Home
blogComponent8.p1: What makes you feel at home? Late-night tea & gossip with mom, the dressing up and colours of festivities, the teen-patti with friends, the drives to the gateway of favourite paan waala, your simple pleasures of life, your food? There is so much that turns a concrete house into a warm home.
blogComponent8.p2: It might be difficult to bring the people in your life daily but you can definitely bring their taste back into your lives. The mouth-watering jalebis or the aromatic dal makhani or the dadima ka pickle; food has been a carrier of traditions, love and belongingness since time immemorial. The food cooked in traditional kitchenware brings back the taste and feelings that one feels when at home. The copper water vessel or the brass kadhai and kansa thali; all carry a lineage and stories of our past.
blogComponent8.p4: You must have noticed the brass tiffin box that used to be packed with so much love with the healthiest home-cooked food; the beautiful thali sets that were laid down when guests used to come for dinner; these metals have been a part of the Indian household. Their quality of keeping nutrition intact and fighting toxins was noticed a long time back and thus were sworn upon by our grandparents. For us today; these aren't just scientifically efficient products but have become a glory of the past that should be nurtured.
blogComponent8.p5: It is not strange that when you cook food in these, the aroma of your home is felt. It is not strange that the dinner doesn't stop then until you take that extra bite out of love. It is not strange when your children ask you cheerfully about the fascination of this kitchenware & you tell them childhood stories with nostalgia and pride. In short, some metals have the power to bring back home to wherever you are! This is the power of authenticity and love; it is time to embrace it.
blogComponent8.p6: Did someone say homesick? Not really, now!
blogComponent8.p7: Let's visit our home through vessels and food that define us.

blogComponent1.title: Tips To Clean And Care For Copper And Brass Cookware
blogComponent1.intro1: Copper and brass cookware is functional as cookware and also deeply rooted in tradition. However, first-time buyers often hesitate to use it due to the required upkeep. To keep that warm, golden glow intact, using brass cleaner or copper cleaner is essential.
blogComponent1.intro2: Whether you're new to cooking with traditional metals or you've inherited heirloom pieces, let's make it easy. Here are some effective ways to clean and care for your metal cookware without any damage.
blogComponent1.cleaningP1: Brass and copper naturally develop a patina over time due to oxidation by air. This aging process is completely normal and even desirable to some extent. But most prefer to keep their cookware gleaming in the kitchen. Using the right brass cleaner or copper cleaner can help maintain the shine without stripping away the authenticity of the metal.
blogComponent1.cleaningP2: Remember, patina is not a sign of damage but if your cookware looks dull or darkens eventually, it might be time for a refresh.
blogComponent1.brassCare1: Allow your brass cookware to cool before washing.
blogComponent1.brassCare2: Use mild soap, warm water, and a soft sponge.
blogComponent1.brassCare3: Avoid steel wool or harsh scouring pads that can scratch the surface.
blogComponent1.brassP1: To restore shine, apply a gentle formula-based brass cleaner made to work on the dullness while protecting your hands. The best ones are safe for food-contact surfaces and remove oxidation gently. Rub a small amount on the surface, let it sit briefly, and rinse it off with water.
blogComponent1.brassP2: Repeat once a month or whenever your brass or copper utensil starts looking dull.
blogComponent1.ptalInfo: If you're using P-TAL, then there is no need to procure a safe and easy cleaning solution. Each of their orders comes with a plant-based cleaning solution within the package.
blogComponent1.cleanerSolution: This can be used as a brass cleaner or a copper cleaner solution.
blogComponent1.copperP1: Copper heats quickly and cools down fast because it's a good conductor of heat. That's why it has been ideal for cooking for centuries. Even so, its shiny surface is prone to tarnishing with frequent use.
blogComponent1.copperCare2: Never use acidic or citrus-based dish soaps, which may dull the shine.
blogComponent1.copperCare3: Dry thoroughly after washing to prevent water spots.
blogComponent1.copperP2: To restore that rich, golden finish, use a copper cleaner that's specially formulated for kitchenware. A good one should be food- and skin-safe, non-abrasive, and easy to use. Apply gently, rinse, and dry with a soft cloth.
blogComponent1.copperP3: You'll notice the difference in the appearance and feel like it's new when using it.
blogComponent1.do1: ✔ Clean your cookware frequently to prevent excessive buildup
blogComponent1.do2: ✔ Use natural or brand-recommended brass cleaner or copper cleaner
blogComponent1.do3: ✔ Store your brass and copper cookware in a dry place to avoid moisture exposure
blogComponent1.dont1: ✘ Use any dishwasher settings for copper or brass cookware
blogComponent1.dont2: ✘ Leave food or acidic substances in the cookware overnight
blogComponent1.dont3: ✘ Assume patina means damage when it's just character
blogComponent1.finalP1: Brass and copper cookware are more than cookware but a part of your kitchen. With the right care, these pieces can last generations. Whether you prefer the lived-in look or that fresh-off-the-shelf shine, a good brass cleaner or copper cleaner makes all the difference.
blogComponent1.finalP2: It's all up to you to either let your cookware age beautifully or keep it gleaming. Either way, caring for it can be as meaningful as cooking with it.

blogComponent2.title: How Does Copper Kill the Viruses That Cause Cold and Flu?
blogComponent2.intro1: In today's world, health is everyone's top priority. It has urged people to look for natural ways to protect themselves from toxicity and infections. There is one powerful solution that has been around for centuries, even mentioned in Ayurveda.
blogComponent2.intro2: Copper is used in Ayurveda and traditional healing practices. It is known for its antimicrobial properties. But how does copper kill viruses? Can it help prevent illnesses like the common cold and flu? Let's find out the answers to these questions in the following.
blogComponent2.antimicrobialP1: For centuries, copper has been used in India and ancient civilizations for storing water while maintaining its hygiene. Now, modern research has confirmed what Ayurveda has long believed.
blogComponent2.antimicrobialP2: Copper kills virus and bacteria upon initial contact. Unlike other surfaces where germs can survive for days, they cannot do on copper surfaces. It actively destroys harmful microbes, reducing the risk of infections that might cause you to catch a cold and flu.
blogComponent2.howKillsP1: The science behind copper's virus-killing ability is simple yet fascinating to know. Here is a break down of what happens when a virus comes into contact with copper:
blogComponent2.howKillsP2: When viruses happen to come into contact with any copper surface, it starts a natural reaction. The copper atom starts releasing ions that break down viruses' cell membranes. This damages the virus' genetic material and stops it from multiplying instantly.
blogComponent2.howKillsP3: That is how copper surfaces manage to effectively kill virus responsible for colds and flu on contact.
blogComponent2.copperVsSteelTitle: Is Copper More Effective on Viruses or Steel?
blogComponent2.copperVsSteelP1: Not all surfaces are equally effective when it comes to stopping the spread of viruses. Therefore, here's a comparison between the effect of copper and steel and viruses in detail:
blogComponent2.copperVsSteelP2: On stainless steel, viruses can survive for hours or even days, increasing the risk of transmission. But copper and its alloys, actively eliminate microbes, reducing contamination in a very short time.
blogComponent2.copperVsSteelP3: This is why hospitals, public transport systems, and even household products use copper for protection against viruses.
blogComponent2.everydayUseTitle: Is Copper Good for Everyday Use?
blogComponent2.everydayUseP1: Using copper in daily life can offer added protection against infections too. There is an age-old Ayurvedic practice for boosting immunity by drinking water infused with copper. It is said that storing water in a pure copper water dispenser overnight is believed to purify it.
blogComponent2.everydayUseP2: In parts around the world, people keep copper water bottles and copper water dispensers at home for this reason. People carry copper bottles wherever they go, as in the office, on trips, etc., because of their health benefits.
blogComponent2.everydayUseP3: Additionally, people opt for copper kitchenware and utensils to help reduce the spread of germs.
blogComponent2.dailyImmunityTitle: How to Use Copper for Better Immunity Daily
blogComponent2.dailyImmunityP1:
To make the most of copper's antiviral properties, consider using it in your daily life. Below are 3 simple steps to do it:
- Drink water stored in copper bottles to support immunity and digestion.
- Use copper utensils and cookware so it can add nutrients to your diet.
- Choose copper-based home products to minimize germ spread.
blogComponent2.dailyImmunityP2: With more awareness about natural wellness, globally, more people are turning to traditional wisdom backed by modern science. That's why copper kills viruses efficiently, making it a smart addition to a health-conscious lifestyle.

blogComponent3.title: Copper Deficiency - Causes, Side Effects, and Treatment
blogComponent3.intro: If you're feeling tired, noticing premature gray hair, or experiencing unexplained health changes, then it could be copper deficiency signs that most people overlook. While copper deficiency isn't common, its understanding can help you maintain better health and wellness.
blogComponent3.copperRoleTitle: Understanding Copper's Role in Your Body
blogComponent3.copperRoleP1: Before diving into copper deficiency signs, it's important to understand why this mineral matters. Copper helps create melanin for your hair color, supports brain function, and plays a crucial role in maintaining your immune system. Think of copper as a silent worker, helping your body perform numerous essential tasks daily.
blogComponent3.copperRoleP2: Without adequate copper, many bodily systems can begin to function less efficiently. This is why, since ancient times, according to Ayurveda, people used "tamra jal" which is basically water from a copper-infused dispenser for better health.
blogComponent3.causesP1: The cause of copper deficiency can vary from person to person. Here are some common factors:
blogComponent3.causesP2: Another significant cause of copper deficiency is often overlooked. There is a growing trend of restrictive dieting, which involves eliminating foods rich in copper. This has become increasingly common in our modern society's pursuit of quick-fix diet solutions.
blogComponent3.signsP1: Identifying copper deficiency signs early can help prevent more serious complications. Common indicators include:
blogComponent3.signsP2: These copper deficiency signs might appear gradually, making them easy to dismiss as normal aging or stress-related issues.
blogComponent3.treatmentTitle: Natural Ways to Address Copper Deficiency
blogComponent3.treatmentP1: If you're experiencing copper deficiency signs, several natural approaches can help:
blogComponent3.dietTitle: Include copper-rich foods in your diet
blogComponent3.treatmentP2: Simply adding copper-rich foods might not be enough if underlying issues aren't addressed. You can switch to drinking water from a copper-infused dispenser and cook food in copper utensils lined with non-toxic metals.
blogComponent3.preventionP1: Rather than waiting for copper deficiency signs to appear, take proactive steps:
blogComponent3.prevention2: A balanced diet with copper-rich foods
blogComponent3.prevention5: Monitoring any medications that might affect absorption
blogComponent3.prevention6: Regular exercise to support overall nutrient absorption
blogComponent3.prevention7: Stress management for better nutrient utilization
blogComponent3.preventionP2: Remember, copper deficiency isn't just about lacking a mineral—it's about maintaining your body's delicate balance for optimal health.
blogComponent3.preventionP3: Listen to your body and watch for copper deficiency signs. While the condition is treatable, being aware and taking preventive measures can help you maintain better overall health.

blogComponent4.title: Benefits and Side Effects of Copper Water
blogComponent4.intro: According to Ayurvedic tradition, storing water in copper vessels has been practiced for centuries due to its numerous health benefits. Let's explore both the advantages and potential drawbacks of this ancient practice.
blogComponent4.ancientWisdomTitle: The Ancient Wisdom of Copper Water in Ayurveda
blogComponent4.ancientWisdomP1: In Ayurveda, water stored in copper vessels has been known to balance all three doshas by positively charging the water. The benefits of copper water that Ayurveda practitioners have long advocated stem from copper's natural ability to gently infuse water with healing properties.
blogComponent4.benefit1Desc: Copper's natural antimicrobial properties help eliminate harmful bacteria. Historical evidence suggests copper mine workers showed immunity to cholera during the 1800s.
blogComponent4.benefit2Desc: Copper water reduces stomach inflammation and supports liver and kidney function, aiding people with ulcers or infections.
blogComponent4.benefit3Desc: Its antioxidants fight free radicals, potentially slowing aging, improving skin texture, and promoting cell regeneration.
blogComponent4.benefit4Desc: Individuals with thyroid conditions often have low copper levels. Regular intake may help restore balance.
blogComponent4.benefit5Desc: Copper water may help regulate blood pressure and heart rate and reduce bad cholesterol.
blogComponent4.sideEffectsP1: If you store and drink water from copper vessels, it's important to follow proper cleaning and maintenance procedures. The vessel should be cleaned regularly to prevent oxidation and bacterial growth.
blogComponent4.sideEffectsP2: While copper water offers many benefits, excessive consumption can lead to copper toxicity. Common side effects may include:
blogComponent4.usageGuidelinesP1: For optimal benefits and safety, follow these tips:
blogComponent4.guideline1: Store water for 8–10 hours before drinking.
blogComponent4.guideline2: Clean your copper vessel regularly with lemon and salt.
blogComponent4.guideline3: Only use pure copper vessels without other metal linings.
blogComponent4.guideline4: Do not store acidic beverages in copper containers.
blogComponent4.guideline5: Do not store water in copper for more than 16 hours.
blogComponent4.guideline6: Drink only 1 liter per day—don't overdo it.
blogComponent4.usageGuidelinesP2: These simple habits ensure you receive the healing benefits of copper without risking overconsumption.
blogComponent4.conclusionP1: The practice of storing water in copper vessels offers a variety of potential health benefits if done correctly. The benefits of copper water, as per Ayurvedic traditions, are significant. But it's important to follow safe practices and avoid overuse.
blogComponent4.conclusionP2: Remember, copper water should be part of a balanced, healthy lifestyle, not a miracle cure. Always consult a healthcare provider before incorporating it into your daily routine—especially if you have any underlying health conditions.

blogComponent5.title: Which Type of Water Bottle Should We Use for Drinking Water Everyday?
blogComponent5.intro1: Carrying a water bottle is more than just a convenience; it's a necessity. For maintaining hydration and overall well-being, it's unavoidable—but choosing the best everyday water bottle is just as important as drinking enough water.
blogComponent5.intro2: Plastic bottles, although widely available and lightweight, pose health risks. This is why many people are switching to metal water bottles, particularly copper.
blogComponent5.intro3: Let's explore the differences between the two and help you find the best water bottle for everyday use.
blogComponent5.avoidPlasticTitle: Why You Should Avoid Plastic Bottles
blogComponent5.avoidPlasticP1: While plastic bottles may seem convenient, they come with significant drawbacks:
blogComponent5.healthRisksDesc: Many plastic bottles contain BPA and phthalates, chemicals that can disrupt the endocrine system and have been linked to obesity, hormonal imbalances, and even cancer.
blogComponent5.chemicalLeachingDesc: When exposed to heat or sunlight, plastic can release harmful compounds into your water.
blogComponent5.environmentalImpactDesc: Single-use plastic bottles contribute to pollution and take hundreds of years to decompose.
blogComponent5.avoidPlasticP2: Switching to a copper water bottle eliminates these concerns, offering a healthier and more sustainable option.
blogComponent5.copperVsSteelTitle: Copper vs. Steel Water Bottle: Which One Is Better?
blogComponent5.copperVsSteelP1: When it comes to choosing the best everyday water bottle, metal options like copper and stainless steel are the top contenders. Let's break down their benefits to help you make the right choice.
blogComponent5.copperBenefitsTitle: Benefits of a Copper Water Bottle
blogComponent5.copperNote: Furthermore, copper is best suited for storing plain water rather than acidic or carbonated beverages.
blogComponent5.steelBenefitsTitle: Benefits of a Stainless Steel Water Bottle
blogComponent5.steelBenefitsDesc: Stainless steel bottles offer similar advantages, plus added versatility. They can store both plain water and other beverages (including acidic ones) without reacting or affecting taste.
blogComponent5.findingBestTitle: Finding the Best Water Bottle for Everyday Use
blogComponent5.findingBestP1: When deciding between a copper vs. steel water bottle, consider your lifestyle and needs. If you prioritize health benefits, antimicrobial properties, and a natural cooling effect, a copper bottle is a great choice.
blogComponent5.findingBestP2: Regardless of which metal bottle you choose, they are far superior to plastic bottles in terms of health, durability, and sustainability.
blogComponent5.metalOverPlasticP1: Switching to a metal water bottle is not just a personal health decision—it's an environmental one. Every year, millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills and oceans, harming wildlife and polluting ecosystems.
blogComponent5.metalOverPlasticP2: By using a copper or steel water bottle, you reduce plastic waste and make a long-term investment in your well-being.
blogComponent5.finalThoughtsP1: The best everyday water bottle is one that prioritizes your health, sustainability, and convenience. Whether you choose a copper or steel bottle, both offer benefits that plastic simply can't match.
blogComponent5.finalThoughtsP2: Investing in a high-quality, reusable bottle is a small step that makes a big difference for both you and the environment.
blogComponent5.finalThoughtsP3: So, which one will you choose? A traditional copper bottle for everyday use or a plastic one that silently makes you sick? The choice is yours, so pick what's actually good for you and the planet.

blogComponent6.title: Which 5 Drinks Are Served in a Copper Mug?
blogComponent6.intro1: Copper mugs have long been associated with Moscow Mules, but their charm doesn't stop there. Today, they're an essential serveware for over 25 hot and cold beverages. These timeless mugs, celebrated for their unique thermal properties, make every sip an experience.
blogComponent6.intro2: Still, people are curious about what drinks are served in a copper mug and wondering if it's okay to use copper mugs for coffee or hot beverages. Let's dive into their versatility and talk about 5 drinks that are served in a copper mug.
blogComponent6.whySpecialP1: Copper mule mugs are more than just stylish. Their functionality makes them indispensable in the culinary world.
blogComponent6.thermalConductivityDesc: Keeps cold drinks icy and warm beverages cozy for longer.
blogComponent6.flavorEnhancementDesc: Subtle metallic notes can elevate the taste of certain drinks.
blogComponent6.timelessAppealDesc: The rustic yet elegant appearance adds a touch of sophistication to any table.
blogComponent6.hotDrinksTitle: Can You Use Copper Mugs for Hot Drinks?
blogComponent6.hotDrinksP1: Yes, copper mugs can be used for hot drinks, but with caution. The metal's conductive nature means the exterior can get quite hot, so ensure beverages are at a comfortable drinking temperature.
blogComponent6.hotDrinksP2: Coffee, tea, and even hot cider taste uniquely delightful when served in a copper mug, as the metal subtly enhances the flavors.
blogComponent6.fiveDrinksTitle: 5 Popular Drinks to Serve in Copper Mugs
blogComponent6.fiveDrinksP1: Here are five drinks that are even more enjoyable in these iconic mugs:
blogComponent6.drink1Desc: The classic cocktail that put copper mugs on the map. This refreshing blend of vodka, ginger beer, and lime juice is a timeless favorite.
blogComponent6.drink2Desc: A non-alcoholic delight, this drink pairs perfectly with copper mugs to stay crisp and chilled longer.
blogComponent6.drink3Desc: A comforting mix of apple cider, rum, and spices—ideal for cold winter nights. The mug's festive charm enhances the experience.
blogComponent6.drink4Desc: A creamy concoction of milk, allspice, and nutmeg. Copper mugs keep it warm and inviting for indulgent sipping.
blogComponent6.drink5Desc: A seasonal twist on traditional sangria, this drink blends spiced syrup, apple brandy, and wine. Copper enhances the flavors and presentation beautifully.
blogComponent6.coffeeP1: Coffee in a copper mug? Absolutely! Copper mugs offer a rustic and warm way to enjoy coffee. Plus, they help maintain the ideal temperature for longer.
blogComponent6.coffeeP2: Opt for lined copper mugs for acidic beverages like coffee to avoid reactions with the metal over time.
blogComponent6.caringP1: Proper care ensures your mugs last for years and retain their shine:
blogComponent6.linedVsUnlinedDesc: Use lined mugs to prevent reactions for hot or acidic drinks.
blogComponent6.cleaningDesc: Handwash with a gentle cleanser and soft sponge to maintain the finish.
blogComponent6.standOutP1: From cocktails to coffee, copper mugs elevate your drinking experience. They're not just drinkware. They're a blend of style, tradition, and functionality.
blogComponent6.standOutP2: Whether you're wondering, "Can you use copper mugs for hot drinks?" or exploring "What drinks are served in a copper mug?" these versatile vessels prove their worth time and again.
blogComponent6.finalThoughtsP1: Copper mugs are more than just a pretty face in your kitchen. They bring a touch of heritage and sophistication to every drink they serve.
blogComponent6.finalThoughtsP2: The next time you sip a Moscow Mule, hot cider, or coffee, do it in a copper mug and enjoy the difference.
blogComponent6.finalThoughtsP3: What's your favorite drink to serve in a copper mug?

blogComponent7.title: Simple, Quick & Easy Cleaning Tips for everyday use of Brass, Copper and Kansa utensils
blogComponent7.intro1: With the growing emphasis on health and the resurfacing of ancient wisdom, the charm of brass, copper and kansa utensils is everywhere. The visibility of these metals is there almost in all households. While the elders are thoroughly impressed with their benefits and purity, younger generation too is quite attracted to their health benefits as well as their cool and fancy designs.
blogComponent7.intro2: However, some problems remain the same. How to clean brass utensils, how to maintain copper vessels, and how to ensure brass utensils cleaning are some of the questions that revolve in our heads on a daily basis. This might come as a surprise to you that maintaining and cleaning copper, brass and kansa is extremely easy!
blogComponent7.intro3: We bring you here some of the coolest, fun and easiest as well as effective ways of cleaning and how to wash brass, copper and kansa vessels!
blogComponent7.methodATitle: A. Plain boiling water and easily available tamarind + vinegar!
blogComponent7.methodAStep1: Add some tamarind and a little vinegar to boiled water, Clean the required item with an absorbent cloth and then immerse in this water. Depending on the amount of stains on the vessel, it needs to be kept in water. Keep checking the vessel at periodic intervals
blogComponent7.methodAStep2: Wash off the vessel with mild soap and dry completely with cloth piece
blogComponent7.methodBTitle: B. The multi-purpose vinegar or lime + salt!
blogComponent7.methodBStep1: Vinegar or lime along with salt can naturally clean utensils of brass, copper and kansa. Put some vinegar over the surface of the vessel and then rub some salt on it. Use a clean kitchen scrubber to scrub the surface
blogComponent7.methodBStep2: Rinse properly and use a dry cloth to clean it
blogComponent7.methodCStep1: Make the pulp of tamarind by soaking it in warm water for couple of hours. You can then muddle it into a pulp leaving a few fibres also. Use this pulp on the metalware and let the fibres also stay on it. Scrub the pieces clean. After scrubbing, use warm water to clean and was any residue that might be left behind
blogComponent7.methodCStep2: Some dishwashing powder/ liquid can be used for final washing followed by cleaning with a dry soft cloth
blogComponent7.methodDStep1: A common kitchen ingredient- atta or flour can be used with lemon juice or some vinegar. Put the mixture of the two on the surface of the metalware. The flour shall be able to hold the cleaning agent (in this, lemon juice or vinegar). Post scrubbing, wash off the vessel with clean water and let it dry
blogComponent7.methodEStep1: It is the easiest way to clean brass metalware. Spread a little ketchup on the area that requires cleaning. Use a clean cloth to rub over the item
blogComponent7.methodFDesc: Pitambari powder is an appropriate choice to clean copper utensils. Only some amount of this powder needs to be rubbed on the surface. Rinse it with water and let it dry with a soft cloth
blogComponent7.careTipsP1: It is also important to take complete care of the metalware after cleaning them. They should be dried in the sun to ensure that no moisture is left behind. How to clean brass, copper and kansa utensils is quite an easy job in totality. One simple needs to use them well and ensure their cleaning which can be done with very simple household items.
blogComponent7.careTipsP2: You must thus feel totally free to use these things of beauty!

useAndCare.title: Simple, Quick & Easy Cleaning Tips For Everyday Use Of Brass, Copper And Kansa Utensils
useAndCare.subtitle: Simple, Quick & Easy Cleaning Tips for everyday use of Brass, Copper and Kansa utensils
useAndCare.intro: With the growing emphasis on health and the resurfacing of ancient wisdom, the charm of brass, copper and kansa utensils is everywhere. The visibility of these metals is there almost in all households. While the elders are thoroughly impressed with their benefits and purity, younger generation too is quite attracted to their health benefits as well as their cool and fancy designs. However, some problems remain the same. How to clean brass utensils, how to maintain copper vessels, and how to ensure brass utensils cleaning are some of the questions that revolve in our heads on a daily basis. This might come as a surprise to you that maintaining and cleaning copper, brass and kansa is extremely easy! We bring you here some of the coolest, fun and easiest as well as effective ways of cleaning and how to wash brass, copper and kansa vessels!

tips.title: 1. Plain boiling water and easily available tamarind or lemon
tips.content: Add some tamarind and a little vinegar or lemon juice to a bowl of hot water. Soak the utensils in this solution for 10–15 minutes depending on the extent of the stains. Scrub with a soft cloth or brush and rinse well. This method helps remove tarnish and restore shine.

tips.title: 2. The multi-purpose baking soda
tips.content: Sprinkle or form a paste with baking soda and water, apply to utensils, and gently scrub. Baking soda helps lift stains and tarnish without scratching the metal.

tips.title: 3. Tamarind paste + dishwashing liquid
tips.content: Make the pulp of tamarind by soaking it in warm water or cooking it further. Mix with a little dishwashing liquid to form a paste. Apply on the utensils and let it sit. Scrub the piece and rinse with water for a bright, clean finish.

tips.title: 4. Lemon + salt
tips.content: Cut a lemon, dip it in salt, and rub it all over the utensil. The mixture of the two acts as a natural abrasive and cleanser.

tips.title: 5. Tomato ketchup
tips.content: Spread a little ketchup on the tarnished area, leave for a few minutes, then clean and rinse. Ketchup contains acids that help remove tarnish.

tips.title: 6. Pitambari
tips.content: Pitambari powder is an appropriate choice to clean copper utensils. Only use minimal water and rub the powder gently for best results.

useAndCare.closingNote: It is also important to take complete care of the metalware after cleaning them. They should be dried in the sun to ensure that no moisture is left behind. How to clean brass, copper and kansa utensils is quite an easy job in totality. One simple needs to use them well and ensure their cleaning which can be done with very simple household items. You must thus feel totally free to use these things of beauty!

logFiles.content: P-tal follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services' analytics. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the site, tracking users' movement on the website, and gathering demographic information.

eligibility.condition1: The item(s) must be in its original condition, unused, and with all original packaging (tags, labels, etc.).
eligibility.condition2: Items damaged due to misuse, neglect, or accidents are not eligible for return. Examples of such misuse include using excessively high heat, storing water for more than 10 hours in copper, improper cleaning, preheating without oil or ghee, or slight discoloration, including natural tarnishing of brass, copper, and bronze.
